# accessInstanceVariablesDirectly

**Type Property**

Returns a Boolean value that indicates whether the key-value coding methods should access the corresponding instance variable directly on finding no accessor method for a property.

## Declaration

```swift
class var accessInstanceVariablesDirectly: Bool { get }
```

## Return Value

[doc://com.apple.objectivec/documentation/ObjectiveC/YES] if the key-value coding methods should access the corresponding instance variable directly on finding no accessor method for a property, otherwise [doc://com.apple.objectivec/documentation/ObjectiveC/NO].

## Discussion

The default returns [doc://com.apple.objectivec/documentation/ObjectiveC/YES]. Subclasses can override it to return [doc://com.apple.objectivec/documentation/ObjectiveC/NO], in which case the key-value coding methods won’t access instance variables.
title: accessInstanceVariablesDirectly
